verses.kjv: The vision of Obadiah. Thus saith the Lord GOD concerning Edom; We have heard a rumour from the LORD, and an ambassador is sent among the heathen, Arise ye, and let us rise up against her in battle.
verses.ct: This is the vision of Obadiah. The Lord GOD speaks this message about Edom: We have received word from the LORD, and a messenger has been sent out among the nations, saying, 'Get up! Let us go to war against her!'

verses.kjv: Behold, I have made thee small among the heathen: thou art greatly despised.
verses.ct: "Pay attention — I have made you insignificant among the nations. You are thoroughly looked down on."

verses.kjv: The pride of thine heart hath deceived thee, thou that dwellest in the clefts of the rock, whose habitation is high; that saith in his heart, Who shall bring me down to the ground?
verses.ct: "Your arrogance has fooled you. You live high up in the rocky cliffs, making your home in the heights, telling yourself, 'No one can bring me down.'"

verses.kjv: Though thou exalt thyself as the eagle, and though thou set thy nest among the stars, thence will I bring thee down, saith the LORD.
verses.ct: "Even if you soar as high as an eagle, even if you build your nest among the stars, I will drag you down from there," declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: If thieves came to thee, if robbers by night, (how art thou cut off!) would they not have stolen till they had enough? if the grapegatherers came to thee, would they not leave some grapes?
verses.ct: "If thieves broke into your home — if robbers came at night — what a disaster you would face! — wouldn't they only steal what they wanted? If grape harvesters came through your vineyard, wouldn't they at least leave a few behind?"

verses.kjv: How are the things of Esau searched out! how are his hidden things sought up!
verses.ct: "But look how completely Esau has been ransacked! Every hidden treasure has been uncovered!"

verses.kjv: All the men of thy confederacy have brought thee even to the border: the men that were at peace with thee have deceived thee, and prevailed against thee; they that eat thy bread have laid a wound under thee: there is none understanding in him.
verses.ct: "All your allies have driven you to the border. Your so-called friends have tricked you and overpowered you. Those who shared meals with you have set a trap for you, and you didn't even see it coming."

verses.kjv: Shall I not in that day, saith the LORD, even destroy the wise men out of Edom, and understanding out of the mount of Esau?
verses.ct: "On that day," declares the LORD, "won't I wipe out the wise from Edom and every person of understanding from the hill country of Esau?"

verses.kjv: And thy mighty men, O Teman, shall be dismayed, to the end that every one of the mount of Esau may be cut off by slaughter.
verses.ct: "Your warriors, Teman, will be filled with terror, so that everyone in the hill country of Esau will be destroyed in the slaughter."

verses.kjv: For thy violence against thy brother Jacob shame shall cover thee, and thou shalt be cut off for ever.
verses.ct: "Because of the brutality you committed against your brother Jacob, disgrace will cover you, and you will be wiped out permanently."

verses.kjv: In the day that thou stoodest on the other side, in the day that the strangers carried away captive his forces, and foreigners entered into his gates, and cast lots upon Jerusalem, even thou wast as one of them.
verses.ct: "On the day you stood by and did nothing — the day when strangers carried off his wealth and foreigners marched through his gates and divided up Jerusalem by casting lots — you were no different from the invaders."

verses.kjv: But thou shouldest not have looked on the day of thy brother in the day that he became a stranger; neither shouldest thou have rejoiced over the children of Judah in the day of their destruction; neither shouldest thou have spoken proudly in the day of distress.
verses.ct: "You should not have gloated over your brother on the day of his misfortune. You should not have celebrated over the people of Judah on the day they were destroyed. You should not have talked so arrogantly on the day of their suffering."

verses.kjv: Thou shouldest not have entered into the gate of my people in the day of their calamity; yea, thou shouldest not have looked on their affliction in the day of their calamity, nor have laid hands on their substance in the day of their calamity;
verses.ct: "You should not have marched through the gates of my people on the day of their disaster. You should not have taken pleasure in their pain on the day of their disaster. You should not have grabbed their possessions on the day of their disaster."

verses.kjv: Neither shouldest thou have stood in the crossway, to cut off those of his that did escape; neither shouldest thou have delivered up those of his that did remain in the day of distress.
verses.ct: "You should not have waited at the crossroads to cut down those trying to escape. You should not have handed over the survivors on the day of their suffering."

verses.kjv: For the day of the LORD is near upon all the heathen: as thou hast done, it shall be done unto thee: thy reward shall return upon thine own head.
verses.ct: "The day of the LORD is approaching for all the nations. Whatever you have done will be done to you. Your own actions will come back on your own head."

verses.kjv: For as ye have drunk upon my holy mountain, so shall all the heathen drink continually, yea, they shall drink, and they shall swallow down, and they shall be as though they had not been.
verses.ct: "Just as you drank on my holy mountain, so all the nations will drink without stopping. They will drink and gulp it down, and they will vanish as if they never existed."

verses.kjv: But upon mount Zion shall be deliverance, and there shall be holiness; and the house of Jacob shall possess their possessions.
verses.ct: "But on Mount Zion there will be rescue, and it will be holy. The descendants of Jacob will reclaim what rightfully belongs to them."

verses.kjv: And the house of Jacob shall be a fire, and the house of Joseph a flame, and the house of Esau for stubble, and they shall kindle in them, and devour them; and there shall not be any remaining of the house of Esau; for the LORD hath spoken it.
verses.ct: "The descendants of Jacob will become a fire, and the descendants of Joseph a flame, while the descendants of Esau will be like dry straw. They will set them ablaze and consume them completely, and no survivor will remain from the house of Esau." The LORD has spoken it.

verses.kjv: And they of the south shall possess the mount of Esau; and they of the plain the Philistines: and they shall possess the fields of Ephraim, and the fields of Samaria: and Benjamin shall possess Gilead.
verses.ct: People from the southern region will take over the hill country of Esau, and people from the foothills will take over Philistine territory. They will also take over the territory of Ephraim and Samaria, and Benjamin will take over Gilead.

verses.kjv: And the captivity of this host of the children of Israel shall possess that of the Canaanites, even unto Zarephath; and the captivity of Jerusalem, which is in Sepharad, shall possess the cities of the south.
verses.ct: The exiles from this army of the Israelites will take over the land of the Canaanites as far as Zarephath, and the exiles from Jerusalem who are in Sepharad will take over the cities of the southern region.

verses.kjv: And saviours shall come up on mount Zion to judge the mount of Esau; and the kingdom shall be the LORD’s.
verses.ct: Deliverers will go up on Mount Zion to rule over the hill country of Esau, and the kingdom will belong to the LORD.
